        This bug requires manual review: M92's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M92's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5.           Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1221406#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Hello, CVE IDs are automatically issued for vulnerabilities discovered in Stable and are allocated upon the release of the stable channel version containing the fix. As this issue discovered in beta, it was not allocated a CVE. Upon your request, I have issued a CVE ID - CVE-2021-38023. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, CVE IDs are automatically issued for vulnerabilities discovered in Stable and are allocated upon the release of the stable channel version containing the fix. As this issue discovered in beta, it was not allocated a CVE. Upon your request, I have issued a CVE ID - CVE-2021-38023. <!----></span><br>The description will be filed with MITRE in the future and this bug report serves as the public information about the vulnerability at this time.<span class="line"><!---->The description will be filed with MITRE in the future and this bug report serves as the public information about the vulnerability at this time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This would be sev-crit, except that it requires installing an extension,so I think we can should it as sev-high.  I'd expect it to be present on all the platforms that support extensions.<span class="line"><!---->This would be sev-crit, except that it requires installing an extension,so I think we can should it as sev-high.  I'd expect it to be present on all the platforms that support extensions.<!----></span><br><br>I'm guessing this might be related to <span class="line"><!---->I'm guessing this might be related to <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/1e9fda56402e14c040fca088605b00332633b690<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/1e9fda56402e14c040fca088605b00332633b690"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/1e9fda56402e14c040fca088605b00332633b690<!----></a> - jkim, can you take a look or re-assign as appropriate?<span class="line"><!----> - jkim, can you take a look or re-assign as appropriate?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          sa...@chromium.org

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          sa...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          -sa...@chromium.org j...@igalia.com afakhry@chromium.org jam@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        It looks like <span class="line"><!---->It looks like <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2837446<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2837446"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2837446<!----></a> with the ProcessHostOnUI feature is enabled (and nacl enabled) is responsible. With that feature enabled, TaskGroup::RefreshNaClDebugStubPort() reports its result synchronously instead of asynchronously. A default chrome.processes.getProcessInfo() call only requests nacl debug stub port, so it's ready to report results and notifies TaskManagerImpl by calling a callback; this completes the extension call and it tears itself down, resulting in the TaskManagerImpl cleaning up and deleting the TaskGroup object that's still in the middle of TaskGroup::Refresh(). Eventually, that all unwinds and TaskGroup::Refresh() continues with a dangling this pointer.<span class="line"><!----> with the ProcessHostOnUI feature is enabled (and nacl enabled) is responsible. With that feature enabled, TaskGroup::RefreshNaClDebugStubPort() reports its result synchronously instead of asynchronously. A default chrome.processes.getProcessInfo() call only requests nacl debug stub port, so it's ready to report results and notifies TaskManagerImpl by calling a callback; this completes the extension call and it tears itself down, resulting in the TaskManagerImpl cleaning up and deleting the TaskGroup object that's still in the middle of TaskGroup::Refresh(). Eventually, that all unwinds and TaskGroup::Refresh() continues with a dangling this pointer.<!----></span><br><br>https://crrev.com/c/2975184<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2975184"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2975184<!----></a> should help.<span class="line"><!----> should help.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

<span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>7c749241a482613087a48013083da2f630f0b2c0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/7c749241a482613087a48013083da2f630f0b2c0"><!---->7c749241a482613087a48013083da2f630f0b2c0<!----></a><br>Author: Sam McNally <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Sam McNally &lt;<!----></span>sammc@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/sammc@chromium.org"><!---->sammc@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 29 02:36:43 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 29 02:36:43 2021<!----></span><br><br>Always report the nacl debug port asynchronously.<span class="line"><!---->Always report the nacl debug port asynchronously.<!----></span><br><br>TaskGroup::RefreshNaClDebugStubPort() reports its result synchronously<span class="line"><!---->TaskGroup::RefreshNaClDebugStubPort() reports its result synchronously<!----></span><br>if the ProcessHostOnUI feature is enabled, and asynchronously otherwise.<span class="line"><!---->if the ProcessHostOnUI feature is enabled, and asynchronously otherwise.<!----></span><br>This complexity is confusing and error-prone so always report the result<span class="line"><!---->This complexity is confusing and error-prone so always report the result<!----></span><br>asynchronously.<span class="line"><!---->asynchronously.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>a16c0a11524b417c3dd5f42014a8958cce07e452<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 33<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1221406#c33">Comment 33<!----></a>

        Hello, CVE IDs are automatically issued for vulnerabilities discovered in Stable and are allocated upon the release of the stable channel version containing the fix. As this issue discovered in beta, it was not allocated a CVE. Upon your request, I have issued a CVE ID - CVE-2021-38023. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, CVE IDs are automatically issued for vulnerabilities discovered in Stable and are allocated upon the release of the stable channel version containing the fix. As this issue discovered in beta, it was not allocated a CVE. Upon your request, I have issued a CVE ID - CVE-2021-38023. <!----></span><br>The description will be filed with MITRE in the future and this bug report serves as the public information about the vulnerability at this time.<span class="line"><!---->The description will be filed with MITRE in the future and this bug report serves as the public information about the vulnerability at this time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        It looks like <span class="line"><!---->It looks like <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2837446<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2837446"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2837446<!----></a> with the ProcessHostOnUI feature is enabled (and nacl enabled) is responsible. With that feature enabled, TaskGroup::RefreshNaClDebugStubPort() reports its result synchronously instead of asynchronously. A default chrome.processes.getProcessInfo() call only requests nacl debug stub port, so it's ready to report results and notifies TaskManagerImpl by calling a callback; this completes the extension call and it tears itself down, resulting in the TaskManagerImpl cleaning up and deleting the TaskGroup object that's still in the middle of TaskGroup::Refresh(). Eventually, that all unwinds and TaskGroup::Refresh() continues with a dangling this pointer.<span class="line"><!----> with the ProcessHostOnUI feature is enabled (and nacl enabled) is responsible. With that feature enabled, TaskGroup::RefreshNaClDebugStubPort() reports its result synchronously instead of asynchronously. A default chrome.processes.getProcessInfo() call only requests nacl debug stub port, so it's ready to report results and notifies TaskManagerImpl by calling a callback; this completes the extension call and it tears itself down, resulting in the TaskManagerImpl cleaning up and deleting the TaskGroup object that's still in the middle of TaskGroup::Refresh(). Eventually, that all unwinds and TaskGroup::Refresh() continues with a dangling this pointer.<!----></span><br><br>https://crrev.com/c/2975184<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2975184"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2975184<!----></a> should help.<span class="line"><!----> should help.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Thanks for updating manifest.json.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for updating manifest.json.<!----></span><br>I realized that my environment has disabled NaCl after reading <span class="line"><!---->I realized that my environment has disabled NaCl after reading <!----></span>comment 8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->comment 8<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>After enabling it, I reproduced this issue and verified the CL mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->After enabling it, I reproduced this issue and verified the CL mentioned in <!----></span>comment 8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->comment 8<!----></a> fixes this issue.<span class="line"><!----> fixes this issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hello, CVE IDs are automatically issued for vulnerabilities discovered in Stable and are allocated upon the release of the stable channel version containing the fix. As this issue discovered in beta, it was not allocated a CVE. Upon your request, I have issued a CVE ID - CVE-2021-38023. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, CVE IDs are automatically issued for vulnerabilities discovered in Stable and are allocated upon the release of the stable channel version containing the fix. As this issue discovered in beta, it was not allocated a CVE. Upon your request, I have issued a CVE ID - CVE-2021-38023. <!----></span><br>The description will be filed with MITRE in the future and this bug report serves as the public information about the vulnerability at this time.<span class="line"><!---->The description will be filed with MITRE in the future and this bug report serves as the public information about the vulnerability at this time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
